8b0ae6e7-2455-47af-ae9c-b62ff11a9323.description: Earners of the Cultural Awareness badge will have demonstrated the value and dignity of individuals and groups across all cultural contexts, and advocate for inclusion and equity. These candidates are able to identify and summarize dimensions of diversity, including cultural groups of socioeconomic class, disability, gender roles, ethnicity, spirituality, and sexual orientation.
8b0ae6e7-2455-47af-ae9c-b62ff11a9323.name: Cultural Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: MP505 Diversity and Psychology
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following optional course: MP502 Professional Ethics in Psychology

158161a2-a69d-4f6d-a62b-597dff86efdb.description: Earners of the Information Literacy badge will have demonstrated a working knowledge of how to apply research methods in psychology. These candidates are able to write an expert review of an experimental report, write a project proposal, and select appropriate articles for use with the project.
158161a2-a69d-4f6d-a62b-597dff86efdb.name: Information Literacy

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course:  MP525 Research Methods in Psychology
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following optional course: MP615A Applied Research Project 1

1a65bd9f-d5b5-4a84-afaf-fab7e9ad66ff.description: Earners of the Ethics in Forensic Psychology badge have developed the skills to be able to utilize the American Counseling Association Code of Ethics, and apply forensic psychology and counseling cases and ethical dilemmas to at least one ethical decision making model while incorporating relevant cultural and diversity frameworks.
1a65bd9f-d5b5-4a84-afaf-fab7e9ad66ff.name: Ethics in Forensic Psychology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO611 Ethical and Professional Issues
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO703 Social and Cultural Foundations in Counseling

c84cbb4c-9f94-416c-bee0-762276e339c9.description: Earners of the Forensic Research Applications badge have developed skills in researching forensic psychology topics using electronic libraries, learning various research methods as well as applying the appropriate research methodology to their own scholarship interests.
c84cbb4c-9f94-416c-bee0-762276e339c9.name: Forensic Research Applications

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO614 Research Methods
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO704 Biological Bases & Psychopharmacology
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO707 Assessment in Counseling

f3878811-234b-4a3b-8126-8f2d3b4887d4.description: This program provides an intermediate level overview in understanding and applying core concepts related to DEI within organizations and human resource teams. Participants explore program materials through a guided learning format with touchpoints throughout each session for individual reflection. The four DEI session topics for this program are a) Background and Rationale of DEI; DEI Considerations; DEI Strategies and Application; and Coming Together, Sharing, and Next Steps.
f3878811-234b-4a3b-8126-8f2d3b4887d4.name: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) in Organizations and Human Resources

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete three recorded and one live session with 4 hours total.

20e89ba4-5720-4146-b4a5-7333c9176f89.description: This program provides an intermediate level overview in understanding and applying core concepts related to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) in child and adolescent development. The four DEI session topics for this program are a) Background and Rationale of DEI; b) DEI Considerations in Child and Adolescent Development; c) DEI Strategies and Application, and d) Coming Together, Sharing, and Next Steps.
20e89ba4-5720-4146-b4a5-7333c9176f89.name: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: Child and Adolescent Development

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Participants explore and address program materials through a guided learning format with touchpoints throughout each session for individual reflection. Earners complete three recorded and one live session with 4 hours total.

118148b5-5d96-4020-b427-185922f2c6ce.description: Earners of the Research Methodologies in Practice digital credential have developed the skills necessary to demonstrate an understanding of qualitative, quantitative, action, and mixed-methods research designs. They are competent in identifying the differences between these research approaches and describing their application in online and face-to-face settings.
118148b5-5d96-4020-b427-185922f2c6ce.name: Research Methodologies in Practice

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners participated in a four-part webinar series and accurately completed post-webinar assessments.
Participants are required to complete a five-item post-webinar assessment for each presentation included in the series.

30700b30-3640-4987-bceb-b7a4dbeb7f1f.description: Earners of the Social & Community Psychology badge will have demonstrated knowledge acquisition on the social, cultural, and environmental influences on psychology and community well-being. These candidates are able to design and evaluate programs intended to prevent and heal mental disorders and social problems.
30700b30-3640-4987-bceb-b7a4dbeb7f1f.name: Social & Community Psychology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: MP540 Community and Environmental Psychology
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following optional course: MP502 Professional Ethics in Psychology

68649361-fc50-4504-bcc0-5c9af976106f.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated the ability to comprehend data and information presented in research articles and the ability to apply this knowledge to organizational problems, knowledge of test development, descriptive statistics, data management, basic statistical procedures, and program evaluation principles. Earners are able to apply univariate and multivariate statistics using computer programs designed to fulfill the needs of practitioners to address organizational problems.
68649361-fc50-4504-bcc0-5c9af976106f.name: Statistics

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the Statistics course and associated lab in Statistics

0be17753-24c2-48c1-800d-d9a8af106124.description: Earners of the Child & Adolescent Psychology badge will have demonstrated knowledge acquisition of how theory, research, and practice have contributed to the understanding of development and the treatment of children and adolescents. These candidates are able to describe and discuss life cycle dynamics and healthy family functioning. In addition, candidates are able to assess the barriers that exist in the current field of mental health for children and adolescents.
0be17753-24c2-48c1-800d-d9a8af106124.name: Child & Adolescent Psychology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: MP642 Evidenced Based Programs for Children and Adolescents

aba53036-32ca-4a9a-8aed-f5cdc004d6f9.description: Participants watch recordings from a panel of experts to practice mindfulness and critical awareness for social justice. They will develop plans to improve intercultural competency skills while also taking action for social justice. Learners will be able to clinically explain why all cases need cultural adaptation because no two individuals have identical learning histories and situational contexts.
aba53036-32ca-4a9a-8aed-f5cdc004d6f9.name: Mindfulness and Acceptance for Intercultural Competency and Social Justice

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Watch 4 recordings from experts with guided work and assessment.
Watch 4 recordings from experts with guided work and assessment.

0f51c9e4-4707-414b-8544-1862f933fbbb.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated knowledge of how information is interpreted by individuals, how feedback and mapping influence human behavior, the types and causes of user errors, how the structuring of complex choices affects preferences, and various other tools to influence human choice and behavior. Earners are able to encourage positive behavioral outcomes while maintaining free choice.
0f51c9e4-4707-414b-8544-1862f933fbbb.name: Behavioral Change

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: Choice Architecture

85c3ac0d-49d4-45fb-8d57-0478809a6ea3.description: This program provides an opportunity for students to examine human rights in the Filipino context, including the history, politics, cultural norms, and societal expectations of the country. Using a research and practice lens, emphasizing the importance of contextual factors in- country, students will sharpen their global leadership skills and critically evaluate the nature of trauma-informed care and organizational advocacy in collaboration with selected Filipino partners.
85c3ac0d-49d4-45fb-8d57-0478809a6ea3.name: Human Rights in the Philippines

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of four quizzes (mandatory) and four discussions' participation (optional).

0e7844e3-61b1-4cc7-9702-73132dc010f0.description: Earners of the Assessment & Treatment badge in Forensic Psychology and Counseling have developed skills to gather relevant background information during administration of a clinical interview, mental status examination, and any appropriate questionnaires in order to conceptualize a case with the goal of developing a cultural relevant and appropriate treatment plan for the client(s).
0e7844e3-61b1-4cc7-9702-73132dc010f0.name: Assessment & Treatment

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO625 Assessment & Treatment of Substance-Related & Addictive Disorders
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO707 Assessment in Counseling
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO715 Diagnosis and Treatment Planning

skills.name: Mental Status And Generating An Appropriate Culturally Relevant Treatment Plan
Selecting Administering And Interpreting Assessment Instruments

d42b5a8a-75e3-4fdd-ad60-fa594bcd5cd0.description: Earners of this badge can provide an overview of the impact of stress and trauma in school settings. They explored how stress and burnout impacts teaching and learning practices and identified opportunities for creating a trauma responsive school.
d42b5a8a-75e3-4fdd-ad60-fa594bcd5cd0.name: Creating a School Culture: Managing Stress & Burnout

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed a course with learning activities and reflections.

a81ffaa1-b4d7-44cc-8cdc-2ef502160cc8.description: Earners of the Trauma & Crisis Intervention badge will have demonstrated knowledge acquisition on the impact of trauma on individuals, support networks, and communities. These candidates are able to analyze evidence based approaches for prevention and treatment of child trauma and employ such in the design of a treatment plan.
a81ffaa1-b4d7-44cc-8cdc-2ef502160cc8.name: Trauma & Crisis Intervention

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: MP541 Trauma and Crisis Intervention course
Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following Optional course: MP529 Psychopathology and Behavior Disorders course

ad981efd-c4b1-4119-b640-098cfead94f6.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated the ability to collect and analyze data using quantitative and qualitative data collection methods. Earners are able to design, conduct, and manage quantitative research; ask survey questions that the get the information you need; conduct mail, web, and telephone surveys; manage, analyze, and interpret survey data; choose the right types of analysis; understand and communicate the impact of sampling techniques and sample size; report survey findings.
ad981efd-c4b1-4119-b640-098cfead94f6.name: Market Research and Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: Consumer Motivation and Understanding Consumer Perceptions (quantitatively and qualitatively)

ad0058b3-c863-4fea-8d84-e780192a8da5.description: This program provides training for mental health professionals working with Armenian populations globally with specific focus on post-war veterans and their families. Participants will learn about the Armenian post-war context and its impact on veterans' mental health and well-being. Strategies will be provided that are rooted in the cultural context, trauma, and healing. There will be opportunities to reflect and apply program materials to specific cases.
ad0058b3-c863-4fea-8d84-e780192a8da5.name: Mental Health: Post-War Armenian Veterans and their Families

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete three recorded sessions (6 hours total)

5f401899-9110-40fa-913c-02f625a5260c.description: Earners of the Teaching Academic Writing Through Course Curriculum have demonstrated deep understanding of frameworks, pedagogies, and critical approaches to writing support for students across degree levels. They have learned to identify where students fall on a continuum of academic literacy and learning type and what skills and resources students need in order to advance their literacy skills.
5f401899-9110-40fa-913c-02f625a5260c.name: Teaching Academic Writing Through Course Curriculum

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a rigorous, self-paced 4-module course with an instructor moderator. Earners submit multiple knowledge checks and final deliverables, assessed by the instructor, to earn credential.

c7391d65-77bc-486d-899a-3cbcf8834a01.description: Earners of the Educational Research badge have the foundational skills to collect and analyze data in the field of Educational Psychology and Technology. Badge recipients possess the knowledge to conduct scholarship focused on explaining how learning occurs in educational and organizational contexts. They demonstrate abilities to conduct both quantitative and qualitative research activities.
c7391d65-77bc-486d-899a-3cbcf8834a01.name: Educational Research

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP635, EP607, and EP621

78876b6b-b100-4a32-8e90-283fea2ede90.description: Earners of the Educational Technology badge have developed the skill set needed to design technology-enhanced learning environments that are inclusive of appropriate educational psychology theories. Badge recipients possess the knowledge to discuss theoretical underpinnings and philosophical issues of technology and education. They are able to select, prepare, and evaluate the integration of instructional technology into diverse learning systems.
78876b6b-b100-4a32-8e90-283fea2ede90.name: Educational Technology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP628, EP705, and EP732

eb6e3fda-7056-46ad-b1e3-22b1026eb445.description: Earners of the Ethical Decision Making badge have knowledge of the ethics and standards that impact the field of Educational Psychology and Technology. Badge recipients are able to investigate ethical practices in the field and convey the implications that exist for practitioners. They are able to discuss ethical considerations that impact issues of social justice and how technological evolutions may affect ethical standards, policies, and practices.
eb6e3fda-7056-46ad-b1e3-22b1026eb445.name: Ethical Decision Making

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: EP739

14c30a42-fe9c-4d8d-a87d-172aed3042bd.description: Earners of the Increasing Mental Health Awareness Hackathon Event digital credential have developed the skills necessary to demonstrate an understanding of how to develop digital projects focused on improving lives around the world. They are competent in developing culturally appropriate digital projects to help advance the awareness of mental health in challenging times.
14c30a42-fe9c-4d8d-a87d-172aed3042bd.name: Increasing Mental Health Awareness Hackathon Event

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners participated in a five-day hackathon event focused on spurring on mental health awareness.

97fbd35f-68fa-40db-81d3-74a9f36ed03d.description: Earners of the Learning Theory Application badge have a foundational understanding of how individuals acquire and retain knowledge. Badge recipients are able to create and edit educational content and training materials that are inclusive of appropriate learning and motivational theories that enhance diverse student learning and successful employee productivity. They are also able to explain how cognitive, emotional, environmental influences, and past experiences impact knowledge acquisition.
97fbd35f-68fa-40db-81d3-74a9f36ed03d.name: Learning Theory Application

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP600 and EP614

76bd1a84-3596-4101-ad81-211987fdc56d.description: Earners of the Needs Analysis badge have developed the primary skills necessary to identify, analyze, and determine the learning needs of diverse individuals and groups. Badge recipients are able to identify the differences between educational and organizational procedures and what needs to be completed to improve current processes. They are able to ascertain the best use of resources and make recommendations for program improvement.
76bd1a84-3596-4101-ad81-211987fdc56d.name: Needs Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP715 and EP716

352e2dc3-3ccd-418f-9e34-90850425d4b9.description: Earners of the Trauma Counseling badge have familiarized themselves with the most up-to-date research on trauma counseling for both victims and perpetrators of crimes as well as developed skills in the diagnosis of clients experiencing trauma as well as the implementation of the most relevant trauma counseling practices to treat those clients.
352e2dc3-3ccd-418f-9e34-90850425d4b9.name: Trauma Counseling

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

Selecting Administering And Interpreting Assessment Instruments

891d55bc-9b59-4be6-aa50-4e62e3b5ff88.description: Earners of the Professional Identity badge have developed a professional identity as a counselor from reading the literature in the field, developing a curriculum vitae as well as professional writing skills, integrating at least one theoretical orientation into their conceptualization of cases, and participating in counseling skills development in class and on their practicum/internship, while sharping their style of therapy during appropriate individual and group supervision.
891d55bc-9b59-4be6-aa50-4e62e3b5ff88.name: Professional Identity

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO680 Clinical Practicum
Credit for FO685 Internship I

e4ec9e42-c0ef-4652-a1c9-55f79354224b.description: Earners examined cultural programs and interventions and learned to design and evaluate the efficacy of cultural centered interventions in diverse global settings in underdeveloped and developing countries.
e4ec9e42-c0ef-4652-a1c9-55f79354224b.name: Program Design and Evaluation in International Psychology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed one course lasting 2 months at TCS with the International Psychology Department.

3e8ba8f2-2946-4fb6-a6eb-b0c62f049232.description: Earners can explain the background and rational for advocacy for individuals with disabilities. They are able to describe the variables employers need to consider including identifying laws and the differences between diversity an equal opportunity. They can apply strategies to assist in retention of individuals with disabilities, develop next steps in using DEI, and apply JEDI concepts to the workplace.
3e8ba8f2-2946-4fb6-a6eb-b0c62f049232.name: Supporting Individuals with Disabilities in the Workplace

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earner completed 4 hours of hybrid coursework in supporting individuals with disabilities in the workplace through TCSPP Office of Continuing Education.
Earners completed a comprehensive assessment covering the materials related to the coursework at a mastery level.

89d5fb67-b951-4e0a-81dd-562908446c7e.description: Earners of the Assessment digital credential have developed the skills for selecting, administering, and interpreting assessment instruments and techniques relevant to diagnosis, treatment planning, career decision-making, individual and group counseling. They are competent with assessments across areas including behavioral observations, environmental, intellectual, personality, mental status and computer-assisted assessment.
89d5fb67-b951-4e0a-81dd-562908446c7e.name: Clinical Assessment

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: CM571; CM 564; CM730

ec95dab2-57d8-45bd-98f0-4be29e55b06b.description: Earners of the Counseling & Leadership badge have developed skills in leading counseling sessions of individuals and groups, as well as taking on a leadership role in courses, professional development seminars and/or residencies.
ec95dab2-57d8-45bd-98f0-4be29e55b06b.name: Counseling & Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: FO637 Theories of Counseling and Psychotherapy

Credit for FO750 Residency 1
Credit for FO760 Residency 2

a7e42f39-22fe-488b-89bf-0e2ccc7a81cc.description: Earners of the Instructional Design badge possess the core skills, expertise, and knowledge, needed to design, develop, implement, and evaluate innovative educational courses and training programs. Badge recipients are knowledgeable in theoretical and practical concepts and possess the expertise needed to analyze learning needs and to understand effective instructional approaches. They are able to analyze, design, and employ appropriate design principles for instructional development processes.
a7e42f39-22fe-488b-89bf-0e2ccc7a81cc.name: Instructional Design

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP763, EP764, and EP765

4f029b69-236a-431f-8480-d94a013f1316.description: Earners learned methodologies (qualitative, quantitative, and mixed methods) and quasi-experimental designs to conduct research internationally and in the US using cross-cultural and multicultural paradigms. They conducted statistical tests (ANOVA, multiple regression, factor analysis) in SPSS software and learned to interpret data, statistical significance, effect sizes, and confidence intervals.
4f029b69-236a-431f-8480-d94a013f1316.name: Global Research Methods [Level 2]

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed three courses lasting 6 months at TCS with the International Psychology Department.

d524b927-db2f-41c6-96a0-8e8c6f28bdd6.description: Earners of the Technology Assisted Mental Health digital credential have developed the skills to ethically and legally provide telebehavioral counseling services. They are competent in conducting intakes, assessment and diagnosis, risk management, and counseling (including documentation and termination) via technology-assisted media, as well as in applying evidenced-based delivery methods.
d524b927-db2f-41c6-96a0-8e8c6f28bdd6.name: Telemental Health

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: CM597; CM605 via VCTC

skills.name: Distance Or Technology Assisted Mental Health

2a980de9-6d53-4b14-8ab0-67de89d83053.description: Earners of the Building and Guiding NGO Partnerships have demonstrated the ability to build cultural understandings and are able to use the NGO’s needs to build short and long-term goals that are mutually beneficial. They have the knowledge to maintain partnerships and know how to monitor and track progress on identified projects.
2a980de9-6d53-4b14-8ab0-67de89d83053.name: Building and Guiding NGO Partnerships

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed a four-week training.
Earners created a product that encompasses the goals of an identified NGO.

146c6a16-6144-4172-abeb-8b6bcbde3a80.description: Earners of the Create and Innovate badge have developed the skills needed to demonstrate their understanding of the importance of integrating the innovative technologies of robotics and artificial intelligence into educational and organizational settings. They are competent in demonstrating and applying the importance of innovative technologies and accessibility in professional settings.
146c6a16-6144-4172-abeb-8b6bcbde3a80.name: Create and Innovate

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Acquire real-world experience with innovative technologies and accessibility in educational settings.

8f5e1e3e-1c44-4f68-b8e9-7a77d363001b.description: Earners of the Higher Education and Technology badge have the expertise to investigate and implement technology and technology-based curriculum into university and college learning contexts. Badge recipients possess the knowledge to design online learning environments and offer recommendations for improvements. They are able to demonstrate the benefits of effective technology adoption, evaluate instructional methods, assess student-learning outcomes, and discuss future trends in online learning.
8f5e1e3e-1c44-4f68-b8e9-7a77d363001b.name: Higher Education and Technology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP767, EP768, and EP769

d8836027-7d52-4f78-bbcd-0bf8879fb646.description: Earners learned to do advocacy work and evaluated methods to conduct psychological mental health assessments focusing on trauma and traumatic stress in the contexts of disasters, displacement, social unrest, terrorism, and violence. They acquired knowledge to write grants to present to global funding institutions and to develop cross-cultural adaptation of existent instruments in the field of trauma to be used in international populations.
d8836027-7d52-4f78-bbcd-0bf8879fb646.name: Global Mental Health

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed three courses lasting 6 months at TCS with the International Psychology Department.

4931aa10-e750-493b-9fb7-cbc37639af6f.description: Earners examined human rights convention and learned social justice and advocacy models to provide mental health care access to vulnerable, marginalized, and underserved populations. They acquired knowledge to write grants to present to global funding institutions.
4931aa10-e750-493b-9fb7-cbc37639af6f.name: Human Rights and Crisis Response

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed 2 courses lasting 6 months at TCS with the International Psychology Department.

95adad9d-914c-48cd-bdd4-5215eb4f1516.description: Earners of the K-12 Education and Technology badge have the expertise needed to examine how technology impacts teacher knowledge and practices at the primary and secondary learning levels. Badge recipients possess the necessary knowledge to investigate technology integration for positive school change. They are able to develop necessary strategies for technology integration, explore technology initiatives, and examine motivational factors that affect online learning.
95adad9d-914c-48cd-bdd4-5215eb4f1516.name: K-12 Education and Technology

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following courses: EP771, EP772, and EP773

134d8548-625a-49e9-adf0-23f4f12bd753.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated the ability to conduct applied research, integrate and synthesize theories in the study of judgment and choice, assess the effectiveness and impact of interventions, assess the role that individual differences play with respect to judgment and choice, assess an organization’s environment, and generate a plan to address real-world client problems. Earners are able to use principles, concepts, and theories from Behavioral Economics to solve problems.
134d8548-625a-49e9-adf0-23f4f12bd753.name: Applied Behavioral Economics

issuer.summary: issued by The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

entity.name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a passing grade of B or higher in the following course: Capstone Project in Behavioral Economics

4e01e45a-8c71-45aa-8a7f-5b7251683289.description: Earners of the Career Development digital credential have developed the skills needed to apply career development theories, decision-making models, occupational educational information sources and systems, assessment instruments and techniques toward career development and placement. They are competent in professional development program planning and accessing career-related resources, including legal and professional standards and requirements.
4e01e45a-8c71-45aa-8a7f-5b7251683289.name: Career Development

skills.name: Occupational / Educational Information Sources And Systems

876a5dbf-de55-4cac-8617-894fdca9d4e6.description: Earners have demonstrated how individual and cultural differences influence how individuals perceive, comprehend, and use information and how our brain structures are related to judgment and choice. Earners are able to write persuasive messages and communications for marketing and consulting purposes to target diverse consumer market segments and to use Neuro-marketing techniques (the use of marketing techniques to activate certain structures in the brain) to target ideal consumers.
876a5dbf-de55-4cac-8617-894fdca9d4e6.name: Consumer Influence

70ab629b-4804-45c4-9e90-c98137553ff2.description: Earners learned methodologies (qualitative, quantitative, and mixed methods) to conduct research internationally and in the US using cross-cultural and multicultural paradigms. They analyzed the strengths and limitations of each methodology across a variety of global contexts.
70ab629b-4804-45c4-9e90-c98137553ff2.name: Global Research Methods

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed IN549 course with a passing grade of B or higher at TCS with the International Psychology Department.

4484ab82-b8a0-4c3b-bad4-d0f2c5705bb8.description: Earners developed an international research study, in the field of international psychology, conducted a comprehensive literature review on the area of the study, planned the methodology and design of the study, received approval from institutional review board (IRB) to collect data in a global setting, and defended the research study in front of a committee of experts in the field.
4484ab82-b8a0-4c3b-bad4-d0f2c5705bb8.name: International Psychology Research in Global Context

8e56643b-91a6-4bb2-9225-8a53099d7463.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated how to Identify, evaluate, and apply models, principles, and components of conflict and cooperation that differentiate optimal choices for organizational decisions to cultivate working relationships that lead to productive organizational outcomes. Earners are able to use Game Theory to negotiate and manage conflict and to critically evaluate information for the optimal choice.
8e56643b-91a6-4bb2-9225-8a53099d7463.name: Strategic Negotiation

cd2f28d8-480a-4caf-b391-1ddfe27d70fa.description: Earners are able to describe the ways systemic racism has a direct impact on disparities in health and mental health for cultural and ethnic communities as well as BIPOC individually and use strategies clinically as well as educationally leading to greater equity, diversity and inclusion in clinical practice for mental wellness.
cd2f28d8-480a-4caf-b391-1ddfe27d70fa.name: Systemic Racism and Disparities
